analysis.Summary: Defines and exports a Vue Router route configuration object for the "pages" section of the application: a parent route with an empty layout and a dynamic child route that loads individual Page components asynchronously.
analysis.Purpose: To declare and expose the router definition for all "pages" URLs, including metadata for titles and a code-split child component, so that the main router can include it in the application routing tree.

Components.name: layoutEmpty
Components.role: Wrapper layout component used as the parent shell for all "pages" routes.

Components.name: Page
Components.role: Individual page view component, loaded lazily via dynamic import when a matching URL is visited.

Functions.name: anonymous dynamic import
Functions.description: Asynchronously loads the Page.vue component when the child route is accessed. Annotated with webpackChunkName 'Page' for code splitting.

analysis.Usage: Imported in the main router index (e.g. `import pages from './router/pages.router'`) and added to the `routes` array so that `/pages` and its child URLs are handled by this configuration.
Notes: Uses a catch-all child path `:url+` to match any nested path under `/pages`.
Meta objects contain localized titles for English ('en') and Russian ('ru').
Dynamic import ensures the Page component is lazy-loaded for performance.
No classes are defined; the file exports a plain object.
